      • switchWeapon

        public boolean switchWeapon(int weaponNumber)
        Switches the players weapons. - 1. The players Melee weapon - 2. The players OneHandedWeapon - 3. The players TwoHandedWeapon If the weapon chosen is not currently being held by the player or the player is already using the chosen weapon, this method returns false. If a successful switch occurred then this method returns true
        Parameters:
        weaponNumber - (int) Weapon to switch to
        Returns:
        (boolean) Whether or not the weapon was switched to successfully

      • setWeaponImage

        public void setWeaponImage(java.lang.String weapon)

        Parameters:

      • resetInteracts

        public void resetInteracts(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Class<? extends Interactable>> current)
        Resets the players interacts to those calculated from the game loop. The passed in values are the interacts that are still applied
        Parameters:
        current - (HashSet) Set of interacts to apply

      • kill

        public void kill()
        The player has died. Here because the method is abstract in Character.kill(). When the player dies a bound boolean property is toggled so that the game loop can exit

      • pickUpWeapon

        public Weapon pickUpWeapon(WeaponPickup weapon)
        Allows the player to pickup a weapons and ammo.

        If the player does not already have the weapon then the picked up weapon is added to the players inentory of weapons. The picked up weapon is also set as the players current weapon. When the weapon is picked up the ammo held in the weapon is added to the players inventory as well.

        If the player already has the weapon in their inventory then the ammo of the weapon is picked up and the weapon is removed from the screen.

        Parameters:
        weapon - (WeaponPickup) The weapon object that was picked up
        Returns:
        (Weapon) The players current weapon

      • hasWeapon

        public boolean hasWeapon(java.lang.String weaponSearching)
        Checks whether or not the player has the given weapon
        Parameters:
        weaponSearching - (String) Weapon name to check
        Returns:
        (boolean) True if the player already has the weapon, false otherwise

        Returns:
        (ReadOnlyIntegerProperty) Ammo property of the gun
        Throws:
